articles.author: By ASTRID GALVAN The Associated Press
articles.title: Suit over Border Patrol detention conditions goes to trial
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — A years-old lawsuit challenging detention conditions in several of the Border Patrol’s Arizona stations will go to trial Monday as the agency as a whole has come under fire following several migrant deaths.
articles.content:
PHOENIX (AP) A years-old lawsuit challenging detention conditions in several of the Border Patrols Arizona stations will go to trial Monday as the agency as a whole has come under fire following several migrant deaths.

articles.title: 'Fail Not:' What to watch ahead of Trump's Senate trial

articles.content:

articles.title: Kansas woman pleads guilty to role in her son's death
articles.description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan. (AP) — A Kansas woman has pleaded guilty to involuntary manslaughter in connection with the 2018 death of her baby.
articles.content:
LEAVENWORTH, Kan. (AP) A Kansas woman has pleaded guilty to involuntary manslaughter in connection with the 2018 death of her baby.

articles.title: 'Bungled' restaurant arson gets ex-employee 5 year sentence
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — A former restaurant employee has been sentenced to five years in federal prison for starting fires inside the eatery in the historic heart of Georgia's oldest city.
articles.content:
SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) A former restaurant employee has been sentenced to five years in federal prison for starting fires inside the eatery in the historic heart of Georgia's oldest city.

articles.description: OCALA, Fla. (AP) — A Florida man is in jail on charges he beat an elderly golfer after trying to steal his golf balls at a course, officials said.

articles.title: Recovery begins after stormsthat kill 11 in Midwest, South
articles.description: Thousands remained without electrical power Sunday morning after weekend storms ravaged parts of the Southeast and Midwest, causing 11 deaths, overturning cars, uprooting trees and reducing buildings to rubble.
